radiographic_examinations.findings: Increase in size of a 2.2 cm rounded masslike opacity in the superior segment of the right lower lobe. Previously noted right lower lobe consolidative opacity has substantially improved. No new pneumonia, pleural effusion, or pulmonary edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in size of the right lower lobe mass compared to prior chest CT.

radiographic_examinations.findings: 1.9 x 2.1 x 2.2 cm lobulated mass within the superior segment of the right lower lobe, unchanged eccentric calcifications. No evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality. Improved ground-glass opacities at the right lung base.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Mass larger than 1.4 cm on prior CT.
